question: 障子
sourceMnemonic: It can <kanji>hinder</kanji> a <kanji>child</kanji>, but that's about it. This is a <vocabulary>Japanese Sliding Door</vocabulary>. They're often made of rice paper after all, so, you know, an adult can go through it but a child would be hindered by it.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. The <ja>子</ja> is changed from <ja>し</ja> to <ja>じ</ja>, though, so be careful.
